questiontext.text:
You have discovered two triangles on the board: the small one, \(ABC\), and the big one, \(AB'C'\), which is an enlargement of the first with centre at \(A\).


[[jsxgraph]] var xmin = {#xmin#}; var xmax = {#xmax#}; var ymin = {#ymin#}; var ymax = {#ymax#}; var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('jxgbox', { boundingbox: [xmin, ymax, xmax, ymin], axis:true, showCopyright:false, showNavigation:false, keepAspectRatio:true }); // Base triangle coordinates from STACK var xA = {#xA#}; var yA = {#yA#}; var xB = {#xB#}; var yB = {#yB#}; var xC = {#xC#}; var yC = {#yC#}; // Original triangle ABC var A = board.create('point', [xA, yA], {name:'A', size:2, fixed:true}); var B = board.create('point', [xB, yB], {name:'B', size:2, fixed:true}); var C = board.create('point', [xC, yC], {name:'C', size:2, fixed:true}); var triABC = board.create('polygon', [A,B,C], { borders:{strokeColor:"green", strokeWidth:2}, // green border fillColor:"lightgreen", // green fill fillOpacity:0.4 }); // Scale factor from STACK var k = {#scale_factor#}; // Image triangle A'B'C' (A' = A) var xB1 = {#xB1#}; var yB1 = {#yB1#}; var xC1 = {#xC1#}; var yC1 = {#yC1#}; var B1 = board.create('point', [xB1,yB1], {name:"B'", size:2, color:"red", fixed:true}); var C1 = board.create('point', [xC1,yC1], {name:"C'", size:2, color:"red", fixed:true}); var triA1B1C1 = board.create('polygon',[A,B1,C1], { borders:{strokeColor:"red", strokeWidth:2, dash:2}, // red border fillColor:"pink", // red fill fillOpacity:0.3 }); // Optional: show rays from A to dilated points board.create('line', [A,B1], {straightFirst:true, straightLast:true, strokeColor:"gray", dash:1}); board.create('line', [A,C1], {straightFirst:true, straightLast:true, strokeColor:"gray", dash:1}); [[/jsxgraph]]

Theorem: If \(AB'C'\) is an enlargement of \(ABC\) with centre \(A\) and scale factor \(k\), then \( \triangle ABC \sim \triangle AB'C'\).
